snippet: A startling jump in the number of deaths means doctors need to prescribe more cautiously and do more to educate patients.
abstract: Editorial warns of rise of prescription painkiller overdoses among women, highlighted by the Centers for Disease Control as a public health problem that merits attention; contends it is imperative that doctors prescribe painkillers more judiciously; calls on states to improve their tracking systems to identify doctors and patients who are overusing prescription drugs.
lead_paragraph: A startling jump in the number of deaths means doctors need to prescribe more cautiously and do more to educate patients.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
